title: General view in Firefox
content:
Hi

I'm working with Firefox 91.0 (64bit) and Windows 10. The newest update has changed something, that I need to change back:

When I klick on "bookmarks" (Lesezeichen), the space between the bookmarks is much bigger than before, nearly double. Same thing, when I rightclick on an image etc. for download: much bigger space between the lines for choosing.

I have heard there is a way to correct that in about:config, but I don't know what to do there and I also don't dare to change anything there without knowing exactly what to do.

Can you help me? Thanks a lot

title: Error NS_ERROR_NET_INADEQUATE_SECURITY on every page
content:
Hi, I've been having issues with Firefox for some time now. Every page I got to throws a NS_ERROR_NET_INADEQUATE_SECURITY error. I cannot fix it by setting network.http.spdy.enabled.http2 to false is because Firefox then starts crashing. In the past I've gone around the error by turning http2 off, but recently, first the developer edition, then after today's update to 91.0-0.1 of stable version Firefox crashes if I turn the feature off.

The developer Edition started throwing NS_ERROR_NET_INADEQUATE_SECURITY sometime in spring, then started crashing in June I think. The stable version followed soon as described above.

I am submitting this ticket from a beta version, which for some reason does not have this issue.

I thought it may be the Linux version of Eset, but removing it did not help. I cannot think of any other reason why am I getting those errors, but it seems I am alone because my colleagues don't seem to have this issue neither on macOS, nor Windows.
creator: filip10

title: How to permanently delete a pinned tab so it goes away FOREVER and NEVER COMES BACK?
content:
I created a pinned tab for Google Voice while I was troubleshooting this product. I then decided to get rid of Google Voice in my life and port my phone number to a new VoIP service. Bye Bye Google Voice.

I no longer need or want this pinned tab to keep popping up multiple times on my tab bar. It is like the beast that wouldn't die.

I can mute it, I can unpin it, I can close it, I can club it over the head with a baseball bat and shoot it with a machine gun, but there is no way I've found to PERMANENTLY DELETE A PINNED TAB FOREVER.

It just keeps coming back. Please tell me how to make it stop without resetting my entire browser.
creator: NormG1

title: Průhlednost tabů
content: Po poslední aktualizaci můj firefox zas vypadá hnusně. Myslím, že (opět) zavedli průhledné panely. Jak se toho zbavit? Proton mám vypnutý, je to asi ještě něčím jiným.
creator: tomas.londa

title: Left click does not always open page links
content:
On some sites (e.g. Nottinghampost.com) left click does not open links/ pages. It shows that ti is a link (hand mouse pointer) but will only open with centre click in a new tab. I see that this is a problem that others have had in the past.

I have run Firefox in troubleshooting/ safe mode and problem still happens, so not an extension/ theme issue. I have rebooted the computer and I also always clear cookies/browsing history etc when I exit Firefox, that has not helped. The page links work properly in Chrome. I have also done a virus scan (Panda AV)

I am using current Firefox 91 on Win 10 Pro 64, recently updated but I believe the Firefox issue existed before update.

The issue has existed all this week and possibly longer.
creator: martin246

title: Always show tabs, always show close tab (x)
content:
Hi there, I am coming back to Firefox after about 10 years. I would really like to customise how TABS work because I find the default behaviour disorientating.

Can you help me with the following? 1) I would like the tab bar to ALWAYS be shown, even if there is only one tab. 2) I would like the (x) to close tabs to always be shown, not just when you hover over them with the mouse. I find this confusing because I don't know where the close button is until i mouse over the tab; since the size of the tabs is always different & the border between tabs is hard to see. or if there was some way to keep tabs to a standard width that would be welcome too.

Are these things possible?

title: Searching in adress bar - bookmark keywords - search shortcuts all not working
content:
It's not working, and I can't decide wether I want to search with Google oder DuckDuckGo for example, see screenshot. It only works again after I clear some stuff (see screenshot) through a third party app. (session means "Sitzung", website settings means "Website-Einstellungen")

then it works. Until I open Firefoy another time.

What might have caused it (these are just things that cross my mind, sth else might also cause it):

  1. I did some configuration stuff according to a webite in order to see a black page when a website is loading (since I use dark mode everywhere). That didn't work for me so I set it all back to default.
  2. I wanted to a add a custom search engine (I think it was Google Images) through the addon "Add custom search engine" and it didn't work.

I deactivate the addon, but the problem still remained, so I activated the addon back again. Greetings from Germany

P.S.: I will put a two more screenshot just for the sake of completeness.

creator: praneshkarthims

title: Can't read transparent tabs in Firefox 91
content: Please, please, please, stop changing things that were working just fine. Every time you make one of these pointless UI changes it pushes me towards Chrome. I really prefer Firefox and have used it almost exclusively for over a decade. But how am I supposed to be able to use it when I literally can't read the interface? With every update I am sent to google various solutions posted by other users trying to remedy problems caused by the latest update. I shouldn't have to dive into about:config every time the FF developers decide to play with the source code. I shouldn't have to install UI addons to maintain intuitive workflow. I shouldn't have to append userChrome.css with code copy-pasted from some forum. And this is to say nothing of the users that are inexperienced enough or unwilling to make such changes. Most just switch to Chrome. Sure, some of it is personal preference. "Do you like large tabs or small tabs? Do you like square tabs or rounded tabs?" But when I LITERALLY CANT READ THEM, that's not something ANY user should have to google or fix on their end. That is the developers dropping the ball. Fix this. Firefox developers, YOU fix this. Because I am DONE with midnight scrambles to repair what someone else broke.
creator: corvette_337

title: Websites on Firefox not loading properly
content: After I restarted my computer today (08/12/2021) I noticed that Firefox was not loading websites properly. They're still functioning, but the backgrounds aren't loading in right and that makes navigating them a little tedious (e.g: floating my mouse around where I think navigational buttons are until the hovertext pops up because the lack of backgrounds are hiding the buttons). It looks kind of what I'd imagine the outline of a website would before the background and images loaded in. I've tried disabling/resetting Firefox add-ons/extensions, refreshing Firefox, restarting Firefox, uninstalling and reinstalling Firefox, I've even restarted my computer a couple times, but nothing seems to help. I've also tried seeing if it was a problem on the websites' end, but I've opened them on safari and it has no problem loading any of them. Has someone else experienced something like this?
creator: pcoimbrasanabria

title: Is it possible that Firefox cease providing a button to proceed "Potential Security Risk Ahead"?
content:
I'm wondering if it is possible that Firefox will cease providing a button to proceed to MOZILLA_PKIX_ERROR_SELF_SIGNED_CERT site? My question arises from the following experience.

I connected to a website and the Firefox browser didn't recognize the certificate that the website provided. The following message then popped up: " Potential Security Risk Ahead. " and the user was provided a button to "Accept the Risk and Continue", adding this unsafe website into the exception site list. I think that this is quite insecure. Is it possible that in the future Firefox won't support the button to "Accept the Risk and Continue" to unsafe websites and cease supporting the exception site list to the user?

title: Amazon customer images
content: Today when I started up, I got a notice from Mozilla about a 'new' feature for Pocket. I already use Pocket frequently, so I figured, why not? I said 'OK" (or whatever it was, it was too fast to really remember). Then it wanted to sign me in using what I suppose is my Firefox login (using my Google credential). Well, when I was logged in, I realized the my Google credentials are not what I used to sign into Pocket, since there were no saved items. So, I logged out, and then logged in using my original credentials. Everything was there. OK. Or so I thought. Now, when I go to Amazon pages, I cannot view the customer images in the reviews. If I click on one, I get a very tiny popup that I can't read (because the full text cannot be displayed in this tiny box). If I click on the popup, all I get is an 'x' to close the box. Then if I click on that, the popup disappears and I still can't view the customer images. I don't know how those two could be related, but your Pocket link is the only thing that has changed in this regard. I used to have the Pocket Add In that I used, but that has disappeared from my toolbar. I want to go back to my old add in. And I want to be able to view the customer images on Amazon.
creator: GaijinSue1

title: Unable to change from UTC time
content:
I need some help as I can't seem to reset the timezone of my Firefox browser. Currently it is showing as UTC.

From the console it shows this

new Date() Date Fri Aug 13 2021 00:02:50 GMT+0000 (Coordinated Universal Time)

I've checked about:config and confirmed privacy.resistFingerprinting is set to false.

OS: Windows 10 v21H1 Firefox: 90.0.2 (64-bit)

I've checked the regional settings in Windows and confirmed they are set to my timezone and formats are all correct. So I am racking my brain trying to workout why I can't fix the issue.
